spocs.title: Want to Build a Brand? Here's What You Need to Understand
spocs.excerpt: Even though your brand can seem like a weird, mystic force that surrounds your business, it can be controlled and managed.

spocs.title: Why Live Chat Isn't Just for Customer Service Anymore
spocs.excerpt: For all the time and money we spend attracting customers to our website, isn’t it odd how little we spend trying to convert them?

spocs.title: Why Less Is More When It Comes to Running Software
spocs.excerpt: Run Less Software is more than a philosophy behind how we build software. Let’s map out the battlefield, the armies on it, and their strategies.

spocs.title: How We Fixed Our On Call Process to Avoid Engineer Burnout
spocs.excerpt: Being on call regularly can lead to burnout, apathy or a general desire to never see a computer again.

spocs.title: Gifts to Help New Graduates
spocs.excerpt: We've curated a selection of gifts to help cash-strapped graduates get a head start on their new lives without weighing them down.
spocs.context: Sponsored by The New York Times

spocs.title: 4 Steps to Reaching Financial Independence
spocs.excerpt: There are times when taking out a personal loan can be an advantageous first step - even if the idea of borrowing makes you uneasy.

spocs.title: A Beginner's Guide to Getting Better With Money
spocs.excerpt: Getting better with money isn't rocket science, but it does require action. If you aren't sure where to start, here are eight important steps.

recommendations.title: Younger people are less religious than older ones in many countries, especially in the U.S. and Europe
recommendations.excerpt: For some time now, surveys have shown that younger Americans are less likely than older adults to attend church, believe in God, or say religion is important to them.

recommendations.title: Pregnancy Discrimination Is Rampant Inside America’s Biggest Companies
recommendations.excerpt: When she got pregnant, Otisha Woolbright asked to stop lifting heavy trays at Walmart. Her boss said she had seen Demi Moore do a flip on TV when she was nearly full-term — so being pregnant was “no excuse.” Ms. Woolbright kept lifting until she got hurt.

recommendations.title: Understanding Maslow's Theory of Self-Actualization
recommendations.excerpt: Psychologist Abraham Maslow's theory of self-actualization contends that individuals are motivated to fulfill their potential in life.

recommendations.title: Why You Can’t Really Trust Negative Online Reviews
recommendations.excerpt: Research suggests that people heed negative reviews more than positive ones — despite their questionable credibility.  The Great Wall of China has more than 9,000 Google reviews, with an average of 4.2 stars. Not bad for one of the most astonishing achievements in human history.

recommendations.title: The court’s decision to let AT&T and Time Warner merge is ridiculously bad
recommendations.excerpt: AT&T and Time Warner won a historic court victory this week, convincing Judge Richard Leon in the US District Court for the District of Columbia that they should be able to merge over the antitrust objections of the Department of Justice.

recommendations.title: The Mafia Is More Powerful Than It’s Ever Been
recommendations.excerpt: In different ways, and to varying degrees, the title characters in Alex Perry’s new book, The Good Mothers: The Story of the Three Women Who Took On the World’s Most Powerful Mafia, challenged organized crime in Italy.

recommendations.title: The Death of a Once Great City
recommendations.excerpt: New York has been my home for more than forty years, from the year after the city’s supposed nadir in 1975, when it nearly went bankrupt.

recommendations.title: Free Power From Freeways? China Is Testing Roads Paved With Solar Panels
recommendations.excerpt: JINAN, China — On a smoggy afternoon, huge log carriers and oil tankers thundered down a highway and hurtled around a curve at the bottom of a hill. Only a single, unreinforced guardrail stood between the traffic and a ravine.  The route could make for tough driving under any conditions.

recommendations.title: The Character Who Made Me Love Brooklyn Nine-Nine
recommendations.excerpt: When I first met Amy Santiago, she was everything I never knew I wanted in a television character. I encountered the Cuban-American NYPD detective in early 2014, after Brooklyn Nine-Nine won two Golden Globes in its first season and landed on my radar.

recommendations.title: Dipsea: A Trail Race Where ‘You’re Either the Hunter or the Hunted’
recommendations.excerpt: STINSON BEACH, Calif. — The toughest part of the Dipsea, said to be the country’s oldest trail-running race, might not be the first mile, which contains nearly 700 stairs rising through the forests above Mill Valley.

recommendations.title: Exercise vs. Standing? You Probably Need to Do Both
recommendations.excerpt: Moderate exercise does different things to the body than incidental activities like standing up.  Exercise alone is probably not enough for us to achieve and maintain good health.

recommendations.title: The Dangers of Distracted Parenting
recommendations.excerpt: Smartphones have by now been implicated in so many crummy outcomes—car fatalities, sleep disturbances, empathy loss, relationship problems, failure to notice a clown on a unicycle—that it almost seems easier to list the things they don’t mess up than the things they do.

recommendations.title: So, Is Paul George Out on the Thunder?
recommendations.excerpt: A LeBron-centered offseason can be fascinating, but it’s definitely exhausting. The shadow it casts on everything around the league—from the end of the season, to the draft, to free agency—pushes other story lines to the margins.

recommendations.title: The '8 Hours of Sleep' Rule Is a Myth. Here's What You Should Do Instead
recommendations.excerpt: In today's "hustle-centric" world, sleep is the first thing to hit the chopping block. Gallup has reported that over the past 50 years, we're sleeping one hour less per night than we did back in the 1950s.

recommendations.title: A machine has figured out Rubik’s Cube all by itself
recommendations.excerpt: Yet another bastion of human skill and intelligence has fallen to the onslaught of the machines. A new kind of deep-learning machine has taught itself to solve a Rubik’s Cube without any human assistance.

recommendations.title: Want a beach in your backyard? This man can make your dreams come true
recommendations.excerpt: MAUREPAS, La. — Why travel to a beach when you can have one in your own backyard?  Zydeco Construction specializes in building "swimming ponds" that are crystal blue with a sand surround, resembling a beach. Customers can add outdoor kitchens, gazebos, umbrellas and even volleyball nets.

recommendations.title: Rachel Bloom Has a Lot to Say
recommendations.excerpt: As the final season comes together, the co-creator, writer, and star of Crazy Ex-Girlfriend is plotting her next steps.  Rachel Bloom has every excuse in the world to be exhausted.

recommendations.title: Pain Plus Reflection Equals Progress
recommendations.excerpt: Our most painful moments are also our most important. Rather than run from pain, we need to identify it, accept it, and learn how to use it to better ourselves.  Our images of learning are filled with positive thoughts about how we learn from others.

recommendations.title: The World Needs Netflix Minis
recommendations.excerpt: At 10 p.m. on the final Wednesday of May, shrouded in the darkness of our basement, my wife and I did something we used to do quite often, but now—in the 23rd year of our marriage—we do only rarely.  We sat on our couch and watched a television show at the time it aired.

recommendations.title: Making a Killing in Virtual Real Estate
recommendations.excerpt: Last month, Ryan Kunzmann went to a bar in New York to see his 58,000 square feet of property. No, it’s not the world’s biggest bar—his holdings are virtual.
